basics.name: Niko Muukkonen
basics.label: Full Stack Developer at Reaktor
basics.summary: Developer with a deep passion for quality code and technology-driven leading of development teams. Proven track record of working on comprehensive software solutions, ranging from database management and infrastructure maintenance to user interface development and design.

work.name: Reaktor Innovations Oy
work.summary: Development of an In-Flight Entertainment (IFE) system for a major airline serving over 60 million passengers annually. Utilized multiple techonolgies, e.g. Android, Kotlin, XML, TypeScript and React to implement and test the IFE on resource-constrained hardware running legacy Android versions. Management of a shared codebase to support multi-client solution, navigating the complexities of platform differences and airline-specific requirements.

work.name: Gofore Oyj
work.summary: Full stack development of an administrative web application for a parking solution that handles the management of facilities, products, permits, pricing, sessions etc., employing a tech stack that included React (JavaScript), React Query, Ant Design, Java with Spring Boot, MongoDB, AWS, GitLab CI & Kubernetes. Additionally, contributed to the development of a publicly accessible mobile application using React Native & TypeScript. Later I got the lead responsibility of development, used processes, technical details and specifications of the front end project for the same administrative web application. Provided consultation and support to other teams and team members, aiding them in the implementation and best practices of the front end side of the web application while making sure that the quality is maintained.

work.name: Pinja Digital Oy
work.summary: Full stack software development of supply chain management system Once® By Pinja using many different technologies, e.g., PHP, .NET Core, Javascript, Angular, MSSQL, Docker & Jenkins. A lot of responsibilities and experience on larger customer and in-house projects, production delivery optimization, quality control, testing, deployment, etc.

work.name: University of Jyväskylä
work.summary: Represented the University of Jyväskylä and promoted its study programs to potential students at the Assembly Summer event, the largest computer festival in Finland.

work.name: Storm Motor Oy
work.summary: Sales of motorcycle aftermarket parts, helmets and other equipment

work.name: Savonlinna Works Oy, ANDRITZ Group
work.summary:
Analysis of features and properties of the document management and storage system SharePoint
and the security risks of internal communications and the field of suppliers. Computer and software installations, archiving & factory environment maintenance.

volunteer.summary: I volunteered at the Disobey event in 2025. I was responsible for e.g. providing other volunteers with supplies during the event and participated in the destruction of the event after it ended.

As a mentor for the board of the student association Linkki, I shared my past knowledge by providing guidance, advice and information of best practices, historical conventions and past experiences with the new board members. I also handled the basic introduction and education of association laws and activities to the new board members. After  being with the association for multiple years at this point, I got an honorary mention for my work for the association at the 18th anniversary party which was held in 2024.

volunteer.organization: The Student Union of the University of Jyväskylä
volunteer.position: Deputy Member of The Council of Representatives
volunteer.summary: I was elected as a deputy member to the Council of Representatives, the governing body of the Student Union. In this role, I contributed to decision-making processes, including oversight of rules, budgets, financial statements, and large-scale projects. Collaborated in appointing the Union's Board of Executives, chairpersons, and key staff.

Served as Vice Chairman of the Board for Linkki Jyväskylä ry, a student association for Mathematical Information Technology and Educational Technology students in the University of Jyväskylä. Oversaw the association’s operations alongside the Chairman, managed continuous purchases, supported strategic decision-making, and facilitated the organization of multiple events. Played a key role in fostering community engagement and supporting members’ academic and extracurricular activities. After the year, I was also responsible for educating multiple future boards of the association about association laws and activities.

I was elected as a founding member of the Savonlinna Youth Council (Savonlinnan nuorisovaltuusto), a politically and religiously non-partisan municipal group dedicated to advocating for the interests of local youth. Alongside fulfilling the typical responsibilities of a youth council member, such as promoting youth participation in municipal decision-making and contributing to city-level initiatives, I also took on some graphical design. I refined the design of the council’s logo, which was originally decided by a logo-competition, digitising its colors and graphical elements from a hand-drawn draft. In addition to that, created flyers and other graphical material to support the council’s outreach efforts.

education.summary: Bachelor's thesis on Cybersecurity vulnerabilities of self driving vehicles (in Finnish).
University courses on electronics, energy technologies, chemistry, mathematics ja physics.

publications.name: Cybersecurity vulnerabilities of self driving vehicles
publications.summary: Bachelor's thesis, a small-scale literature review (in Finnish)

projects.name: In-Flight Entertainment (IFE) system
projects.description: In-Flight Entertainment (IFE) system for a major airline serving over 60 million passengers annually. Resource-constrained hardware running legacy Android versions. Shared codebase to support multi-client solution, navigating the complexities of platform differences and airline-specific requirements.

projects.name: React resume
projects.description: You are looking at it! A React application that takes a (modified schema) JSON resume and displays it in a visually appealing way. The application also creates a downloadable PDF version of the resume on the GitHub pages deployment pipelines. The application is responsive and works on all devices wíth a custom mobile layout.

projects.name: Parking solution, private company
projects.description: Parking solution for mobile, web, and kiosks, automatic, semi-automatic or manual parking for consumers, and customers, such as, household companies and parking facility landlords.

projects.name: Event screen for student associations
projects.description: An event screen made to be used in the student space Kattila of the student associations Linkki Jyväskylä ry and Algo ry. Displays information about future events of both student associations, local lunch lists and logos of the sponsors of the associations. The app automatically fetches the information for the screen from multiple sources, so very little to none maintenance is needed. Frontend developed with React and a small backend with Express/Node.js.

projects.name: Jyväsmetro website
projects.description: Refactored and redesigned the website for a large student event Jyväsmetro, which is held annually in Jyväskylä. The website includes information about the event, the program, the location, and the sponsors.

projects.name: Once® By Pinja, Oncenet® By Pinja
projects.description: Once by Pinja is a browser-based SaaS service model system used for real-time management of the supply chains of energy companies with the help of a single system. Once distributes data created in the supply chain in real time to all stakeholders involved in the chain. The system is scalable for supply chain management in case of small individual plants and groups involving several plants alike.

projects.name: Home server, mail camera
projects.description: Home web server setup on an old computer to host a restricted-access public website. The server functioned as a mailbox webcam, detecting motion, capturing incoming mail, and notifying a mobile phone—useful for checking important mail while away for the summer. Also developed web pages and features like automatic data retrieval (internet usage, quota) for remote access. Later, migrated these functions to a Raspberry Pi, adding a home "information display" with news, weather, and time.
